adjectives.description: anal (comparative more anal, superlative most anal)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Of, related to, intended for or involving the anus. [from 18th c.]
(psychoanalysis) Of the stage in psychosexual development when the child's interest is alleged to be concentrated on the anal region.  [from 20th c.]
(psychology) Of a person, compulsive and stubborn, obsessed with neatness and accuracy, supposedly from not having progressed beyond the anal stage. [from 20th c.]
examples: Please don't touch his furniture, as he can get very anal about things like that.

entries.meaning: (entomology, of a vein) Proximate to the thorax.
(countable) Any of the anal scales of a reptile.

examples: In the right mood, I'll accept anal.

verbs.description: anal (third-person singular simple present anals, present participle (US) analing or (Commonwealth) analling, simple past and past participle (US) analed or (Commonwealth) analled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang, rare, chiefly in pornography) To penetrate anally.
examples: The man with the huge cock analed the hot chick.
